Description: Rim sherd of Corinthian black-figured pottery column-krater; interior: glazed black (only traces remaining); on top of flat rim, chain of alternating lotuses with added red on kalyxes (evident only on some) and palmettes with red on cuffs (evident only on some); vertical face of lip glazed; on underside, a single pale brown painted band at junction of rim and neck; on body, some worn black preserved.
Curator's comments: For parallels, see Amyx, D. A. and Lawrence, P., Corinth: Results of Excavations Conducted by the American School of Classical Studies at Athens VII.2: Archaic Corinthian Pottery and the Anaploga Well. Princeton 1975, pl. 32a.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.035) (Phase 1)
